summary: This document is an email chain between a Forensic Accountant at the FBI New York Field Office and a Paralegal Specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY, discussing the organization and transfer of subpoena returns related to the Epstein case, specifically bank records, via USAfx.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The sender of the email, working on the Epstein case, offering to provide productions and requesting access to USAfx to transfer subpoena returns.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: The recipient of the email, who has been organizing subpoena returns for the Epstein case and previously received bank subpoena trackers, requesting uploads to USAfx.

connections.person1: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office
connections.person2: Paralegal Specialist U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
connections.description: Collaborating on the organization and transfer of subpoena returns (bank records) for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Bank Subpoena Tracker Sent
events.description: The Paralegal Specialist sent a tracker of bank subpoenas and returns to the Forensic Accountant.
personsInvolved: Paralegal Specialist U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Email Coordination on Subpoena Returns
events.description: Email exchange coordinating the transfer of subpoena returns via USAfx due to difficulties locating corresponding returns on a shared drive.
personsInvolved: Forensic Accountant FBI New York Field Office
Paralegal Specialist U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email discusses ongoing investigative work on the Epstein case as of June 2020, after Epstein's death.
Bank subpoena returns are a key focus, indicating financial investigation into Epstein's activities.
The FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY are coordinating the transfer of subpoenaed records via USAfx.
Previous transfers of subpoena returns were done on discs, but a shift to digital uploads is requested.
The document references a shared drive and a subpoena tracker, showing organized record-keeping for the investigation.
